Una verdadera obra maestra, la empezé a ver en 2024 y sin lugar a duda es una de las mejores series de la historia. La evolución de los personajes la historia y la acción es un 10. La evolucion de zuko la dualidad del bien y del mal la madurez de aang para afrontar la batalla final. La compasión de Katara la lucha de thof y el liderazgo de zokka hacen de esta serie la mejor

For me this is the best season of the show, even though I absolutely loved book 1 and 2, book 3 changed my perspective of a lot of things, also Zuko’s character development is so powerful and wonderful and the ending was just perfect for this amazing journey of transformation, not only for the characters but also for me.
What else is there to say? One of the greatest shows of all time. Period.
season 3 is the most intense and unpredictable season of the show. truly a perfect way to end a masterpiece of a show. that continues to prove that it can not be done again.
Perfect in every aspect of each episode, overall perfection
A epic and emotional ending to the greatest tv show ever made book three fire just wonderfully made

This season is mind blowing. Absolutely masterful production of an appropriately climactic finale. The overarching story lines are completed and in the most beautiful way. No other show I have ever seen does such a fantastic job at using subtle details and backstories to later tie them in and add depth and intensity to the main story. The character of Zuko might well be the most brilliantly conceived and executed cartoon character of all time. He had so much depth and development. His story will have you crying and going from laughing at and hating him to rooting for him as if he was a real person; a close friend. The ending will leave you with a euphoric feeling that soon fades to tragic emptiness,  just craving more. Avatar: The Last Airbender is truly one of the most beautiful stories I have ever seen put to film and without a doubt the best I have seen adapted for television. I don’t use this word lightly but this show is a masterpiece. The only bad thing about this show is that you can only watch it for the first time once.
The greatest finale to ever be put on the small screen
Really good Show. Good rythm, good story, good characters and personalities.
This is in my opinion the greatest finale any show ever had to this day. The animation, the writing, everything is just perfect.
A master class of television. This stands with the greatest shows ever made. The character arcs alone set this show above so many others.
This is peak animation , peak storytelling we'll probably see in an animated series for a really long time. All 3 seasons are a masterpiece
It manages to retain the descriptor of "perfect" despite a lackluster deus ex machina that undercuts the central moral quandary of the series finale.

Very satisfying end to the story. However I would have liked to see what happend to some of the characters after the story ended, as we are left with quite a few questions. Still a great season in one of the best series I have watched.
The best ending to a show like this. Speechless

Best TV show in history

Wow! What an incredible TV show! This is actually the most successful TV show Nickelodeon has ever created. It has now become my favorite TV show ever! I really appreciate how this TV show focuses on bringing people together rather than resorting to conflict. There are many powerful messages in the show, but the primary one is the importance of the four elements—Water, Earth, Fire, and Air—for our planet's survival. 

I was particularly captivated by Jack De Sena's portrayal of Sokka. Sokka, a 15-year-old, is my favorite character. He is remarkably witty, often coming up with brilliant ideas that turn out to be quite humorous. Additionally, he is a skilled warrior and encourages his friends to strive for what is right.

I also found Zach Tyler Eisen's performance as Aang to be highly engaging. Aang, a 12-year-old, is enthusiastic about exploring the world and displays compassion towards his friends during their adventures. He also has a lighthearted side and prefers to unite rather than fight, always prioritizing others over himself.

Mae Whitman's portrayal of Katara also intrigued and captivated me. Katara, aged 14, is very caring towards her friends but can be assertive when they don't listen to her. She is nurturing and resolute in the face of danger, standing up against injustice and cruelty.

Michaela Jill Murphy's performance as Toph Beifong was equally intriguing and energetic. Toph, also 12, is sarcastic and direct, occasionally displaying bossiness. However, she is compassionate and resolute when it comes to standing up against injustice.

Dante Basco's portrayal of Zuko was also quite intriguing, fascinating, and compassionate. Zuko, aged 16, is intelligent and wise, aiding his friends in resolving conflicts and protecting them.

What I particularly admire about this outstanding TV show is its focus on the significance of the four elements in the world. Water symbolizes flow, creativity, and the act of bringing things into existence. Earth represents the maintenance of land, mindset, and space. Fire embodies strength, energy, and decisive action. Air signifies life-force, trust, beliefs, and determination.

Another aspect I love about this TV show is its portrayal of how a group of exceptional kids can make a difference in the world by believing in themselves. This truly encourages both me and the audience, emphasizing the power of kids to effect positive change by believing in themselves.

I extend my heartfelt gratitude to Michael Dante DiMartino, Bryan Konietzko, and the entire Nickelodeon Studios for creating this remarkable TV show. It is filled with themes of trust, forgiveness, empowerment, fate, destiny, and desire. I sincerely hope that more movies and TV shows with profound societal messages that bring people together and shed light on overlooked stories will continue to be produced.

A continuation of the excellence found in the first two seasons and ups the game even more. Character arcs conclude and mesh so wonderfully. To this day the the best finale in all of TV, animation or not.  I gave it five stars on a technicality, I was unable to give it 100.

AtLA is basically as close to a perfect show as I can think of. Everything it sets out to do, it does with love. The humor is actually pretty good and can provide a nice cushion to the whole evil-tyrant-is-trying-to-take-over-the-world thing. The characters develop in heartfelt, believable, creative ways. The series ends with one of the best wrap-ups of any finale, bringing a logical, emotional and satisfying arc to a close for all major characters. I only passively watched this show on Nick as a kid here and there. Sitting down with it as an adult, I was blown away by the music, themes, colors, characters, worldbuilding, and Avatar's commitment to tell its story and then not stick around for extra cash.
I gave it six stars for being such a fantastic show, but took a star away because the show ended. Five stars, that's my final rating.
A final season so perfect that I don't even need a continuation.
The last season of Avatar brings to a thrilling end the adventures of the kids, who really aren't kids anymore. Their stories are complete. What a ride these three seasons are.
Increible serie, atemporal. gran desarrollo de personajes, creación de universo y en general mi favorita
It's amazing, I doubt the Live Action will live up to the OG animation, let's see.

This show is beautifully written from beginning to end. High watch and rewatch value especially in season 3!
Season 3 of Avatar is the best one yet. Ana amazing build up to one of the best series finale's ever and the character arcs and plot is concluded in a very profound way.

Greatest tv series I have ever watched and rewatched. I watched it as a kid growing up and enjoyed it a lot. Then during my teenage years, I rewatched it with my sister and my parents. Lately, I rewatched it at university with my Uni friends. Each time I appreciated a completely different aspect of the show. It is utter perfection in world-building, character development and the telling of a good story. All can appreciate the show regardless of age or gender or race. It is the epitome of storytelling.

I love the way it portrays the characters and humanizes even those who are in the wrong. I cannot name a single poorly-developed character. I could go on and on about how I admire it's philosophical and spiritual foundation. It encourages the pursuit of learning and living by truth, and it teaches that all life is sacred. I love how it takes the highlights of cultures and histories around the world and brings them together in a unified story of understanding. At the plot's climax, it teaches the importance of justice through non-violence. Throughout the story it shows the blessings of working hard enough to become a master while still maintaining a child-like spirit.

One of the greatest animated series ever made; it's perfectly acted, immaculately animated, the world-building is amazing, the characters are timeless and the story and themes are very mature while also being funny and exciting. The action is also extremely well done and intense.
Still my favorite animated show ever
A must watch for absolutely anyone! Characters, story, worldbuilding.. everything is 10/10!
a masterpiece of media, truly

Best of the best! Number 1!

As a whole it is the best TV show I have ever seen, great for the kids because of it's quirky jokes and important themes, but still entertaining for the adults because of the great story. The format of the show is flawless; individual episodes dealing with small conflicts and developing characters that will tie into the whole plot itself all to be perfectly summed up in a 4-part finale. Book: 3 features the best "bad guy turned good" anyone has ever seen and has a killer finale where the main characters get to face their conflicts. Incredible TV show for any viewer and don't let the fact that it is an anime deter you.

Perfect ending to the perfect series! The character arcs all have such satisfying endings. On rewatching this show I can see so much more that I missed before and now watching it with my brother adds so much more excitement to the experience. I definitely recommend buddy-watching! ATLA isn't just some overhyped kids anime show like I'd been led to believe for so long, it has more emotional depth and character than any "adult" show I've ever seen! This series is a must watch for all ages!

One of the best series I've ever watched and, being in my twenties, I'm not even the target audience. This series certainly lived up to its reputation! I can't believe I missed out on watching this as a kid. I have just finished watching the final episode and am genuinely sad the ride is over. Would definitely recommend.
An amazing end to one of the best shows made in the past 20 years. Avatar holds a special place in my heart, and I can always come back to it knowing it won't disappoint.

The finale season of an epic children's cartoon series that proved that "family friendly" did not have to mean derivative or trite. If there's anything to criticize, it's a few specific episodes that take questionable steps, but nothing too dramatic.

Words cannot describe how great Book 3 is. The story of Zuko is absolutely flawless. Sozin's Comet is the perfect 4-part ending of this perfect series. Avatar: The Last Airbender is a perfect show for children (because it has funny moments and cool fight scenes) and adults (because of the story). This show is a must watch for fans of fantasy.

Book 3: Fire is an AMAZING last season of one of the greatest cartoons, nay, one of the greatest TV shows ever made! Every season got better and this is is the apex, by far!
The characters are better and more developed than they've ever been, in terms of size, scale, and stakes the story has never been bigger, the animation, music, comedy, everything is at its peak in this last season, and it all results in one of, if not, the most satisfying series ending ever made!
Avatar is one of the best shows ever made, and in my opinion, most of that praise is because of how unbelievable this final season is!
I would not watch again, but for anime, it works. The jokes are very childish which is understandable but frankly I wish I hadn't watched.

I appreciate how they show the lives of ordinary Fire Nation citizens, it fleshes out the world in a nice way.  The action scenes continue to be fantastic.  The story is a tad weaker than Season 2, but it's a fantastic ending to the franchise.

Me encantó la historia, los personajes y los chistes tanto que la volví a ver en compañía de mi padre, un par de adultos disfrutando de una serie infantil. Lo único que no me gustó y por lo que no le pongo las 5 estrellas son sus desarrollos románticos, a excepción de Sokka/Suki, están mal construidos, claramente basados en fantasías masculinas infantiles o en ocasiones simplemente parecen sacados de la nada, haciendo uso del poder del guión.
Aún así es totalmente recomendable y una de las mejores series que he visto.

This show shows an incredible and well thought world building, with unimaginable creatures, nations, spirits, and the most notable thing throughout the series: their fight form, also known as Bending. Bending is a form of art where you are allowed to manipulate certain elements (water, air, fire and earth), not everyone is a bender, those who don't have that ability are known as non- benders.
World building is not the only thing worth gushing about. The character development and complexity of said characters are amazingly done. Where we feel sympathy even for the villain, where we see the different traumas of the characters and them working to overcome the effects that war did to them. They overcome fears, make friends, partner, emotional bonds, etc…
This show is… wow amazing *chefs kiss* I highly recommend it. 10/10. The finale was incredible love it
Greatest TV series of all time!  Incredible character development and wow! - What an ending!
Loved the ending to the show.
One of the greatest finales of all time, and like everyone says, Zuko has probably one of or THE best character arc ever.

This season had a lot riding on it with all the build-up the previous two seasons provided, there are each character's personal stories that need to be wrapped up as well as the overall story. With that said this season is my favorite of the three, to be able to pay off something that had that much build-up is nothing short of impressive! This season was is epic that it basically has two finales, this was the perfect conclusion to this vast, epic, and addictive show. There is one tiny gripe I have to say about this season and that is that they failed to deliver on the build-up to Zuko's mother, but aside from that, this season is so good that they even were able to make a recap episode creative and entertaining. I remember when this season was released and watching each new episode with my father, then anxiously awaiting next week's episode. I love this show so much that I had to go out and buy the DVD box set when it came out, I really miss the world of Avatar and hope we get to revisit its fascinating world again soon. What an incredible series!

Absolutely amazing. Nearly everything is leveled up over Book 2 (I still like Book 2 better because Book 3 is missing the best part of the show). That said, this season has by far the best episode selection. Six of my ten favorite episodes are from Book 3. Episodes like Sozin's Comet, The Southern Raiders, Day of Black Sun, Sokka's Master, The Firebending Masters, and The Boiling Rock are flawless pieces of media that I constantly rewatch. This season also has my favorite episode, The Beach. While The Storm and Zuko Alone do resonate with me more and I consider them to be better episodes, The Beach is not only great at humanizing its villains and adding hardcore emotion, but this is the funniest episode. Azula made me laugh out loud at least 5 times and every other character, even the most minor ones, made me burst out laughing. Other good aspects are at their best in this season. The animation is fantastic and truly stunning at times. The action is at its best with the battles in Sozin's Comet and Katara vs Hama are fantastic, creative, and emotional. I also find this to be the funniest season. The Beach and The Ember Island Players are the funniest episodes in the show and moments like "Hello, Zuko here." are literally comedy gold. There are also plenty of tears to be shed. Azula's end, Katara's bloodbending, the campfire scene in The Beach, Sokka and Toph accepting death, and Zuko and Iroh's reunion make me cry every time. The characters are also great. Aang, Katara, Sokka, and Toph are definitely at their best from a humor and character stand point. Aang's fear and dilemna with killing Ozai, Katara's dark vengeance and reluctant trust, and Sokka's rise to leadership are truly compelling character motivations. However, this season does have two issues. The first is minor, and that is one episode. Nightmares and Daydreams is my least favorite episode of any Avatar show. It's humor is awful and so many lines made me facepalm. The tone is inconsistent, going from juvenile and obnoxious to dark and terrifying. The only good things were one or two jokes being so crazy I laughed. What can I say, shock humor just isn't good anymore. However, the real issue is the lack of Iroh. Iroh is hardly in the season, only playing a major role in the finale and maybe one other episode. As he is my favorite character, this initially bothered me. However, I now realize that this does hurt the season. The highlight of the other two seasons was Zuko and Iroh's dynamic. They worked off each other so well and are truly the duo that learns the most in the show. Zuko instead learns a lot on his own in this season. That's all well and good, but I prefer when the two work together. However, the scene where they reunite only works so well because we missed Iroh so much. I can't complain too much, but Iroh is the best character and if he was in the show more, I would have smiled a bit more throughout. Granted, this is nearly perfect and truly media at its absolute best. Too bad Korra never lived up to it.
No amount of delays in its original run could tamper the epicness or emotional power of Book 3, doing the near-impossible by concluding a children's cartoon in spectacularly mature fashion.
Must watch. It is one of the best animated series ever made.

Avatar is one of the funniest and most clever shows of any kind that I've ever seen, and the fact that it's a show for kids makes it all the more impressive. The climax of Season 3 and the entire show is incredibly well done, ensuring maximum replay value and laying the foundation for the Legend of Korra (next on the list).

The story is really good and well-written! In all aspects, book 3 is just as good and amazing as the 2nd book. The characters are still very interesting. Zuko's character development is one of the best.. His redemption arc is very compelling! Also the finale is really thrilling and satisfying!

This show is one of the best cartoon series I've watched!

A perfect season all together, this season is able to go full on dark in its themes with episodes like The Puppet Master while balancing it with more comedic episodes like Ember Island Players or even The Headband. This season can only be described as epic with a great finale that ties up every loose end except Zuko's mothers whereabouts but that information can be found in extended lore for those who are interested. The only gripe I could possibly have is that the fire lord while a clear evil threat and presence has next to no motivations other than mustache twirly world domination. Azula is a much more compelling villain will her lack of motherly love due to her sociopath tendencies, manipulation and cruelty which could have led her to feel she needed to prove herself by ruling the world but that is not to take away from what this series was able to do in its story telling and journey in this incredible world. I am not an anime fan at all but there are two anime shows I have ever been a fan of and that Avatar the Last Air bender and The Boondocks. There is certainly a reason for that.

I've let this season stew for a long time before I wrote this review because I wanted to see if it was truly as good as I thought it was. I have not stopped thinking about it for over a week. It is probably one of the most singularly significant pieces of media that I've come across. It hasn't changed the way I see the world, but it certainly makes it very hard to fall asleep at night without thinking of scenes that had such nuanced meaning. The last 4 episodes (aka the finale) were the best ending to a show I think I've ever seen. The only things that come close are book series from my childhood. I am now jaded with other tv shows. I don't know if I'll ever find one with such growth to it again.
WHY DID THIS SHOW HAVE TO END WWWWWHHHHHYYYYYYY.
no words to speak off

What started as a way to pass through the afternoon tiredness, turned out to be one of the best shows I have ever watched. 
The first season was slow, and a little bit boring to my taste, perfectly during a dopamine detox period. However, as the season 2 begins, the story simply gets more and more interesting. Each episodes draw me in more and more, and push the story to a higher and higher ground. The end of season 2 was absolutely sad, and as season 3 begins, the uprising energy and storyline just keeps going. 
Incredibly inspirational story and full of thoughtful eastern philosophies. 100% would recommend.

Edit after a few days. I have learnt so much from watching this show. The PSD after watching this show is stronger than pretty much all the shows I have watched in the past. The character building is so effective that I felt like I lost a really good friend after the show ends. The utilization of the theme music is near perfection. The emotion I feel every time the Avatar's love starts is indescribable. The creator successfully linked the music a unique emotion with the song, great job guys!

"QUE GRAN AVENTURA, QUE SERA RECORDADA"
Cuando recuerdo en esta serie en la etapa de mi infancia, no puedo no envolverme en sentimentalismo de nostalgia, simplemente la recuerdo con gran cariño y es un gran gusto después de haberla visto otra vez después de tantos años saber que su grandeza no radicaba nada mas en el recuerdo de un niño,para mi simplemente no hay palabras para describirla, en especial porque es difícil explicar ese sentimiento único que ciertos elementos de la historia de Aang me hacían sentir, siento ser sentimentalista, pero eso pasa cuando tratas de describir las cosas con las que tienes un gran vinculo, no se puede evitar. Así que simplemente no puedo poner mi mente en una reseña, solo puedo hablar de lo que yo siento cada vez que pienso en esta historia, pero seré un poco justo conmigo mismo y en resumidas cuentas diré, que la parte final de Avatar:La leyenda de Aang cumple con la expectativa y entrega el final que todos queríamos y al hacer hace también nos entrega muchísimo mas en esa gran conclusión y como toda gran historia se extrañara no tener mas de ella.

The American television series that was commercially successful and acclaimed for its outstanding animation and plot. I've finally watched the whole thing from beginning to end and I can now say it's one of the best and most epic animated TV shows of all time. In a war-torn world of elemental magic, a young boy reawakens to undertake a dangerous mystic quest to fulfill his destiny as the Avatar, and bring peace to the world. Touching on mature themes like war, genocide and imperialism, it is also a series with a defined structure, full of compelling and well-developed characters and a funny sense of humor and good morals. Each episode is a great adventure in its own right, usually concluded with stunning action sequences and the show couldn't have a better conclusion to the story. It is absolutely EPIC!
Amazing, perfect, beautiful. I wasn't able to watch it as a kid because I didn't have cable, but since it was on Netflix I binged it and it's the best TV show I've ever seen! Watch it, please!!
Awesome! Well developed story line. Blows the movie away!

My friend recommend this show to me, and i'm glad he did!
Honestly this show is great! Action amazing, love the comedy, characters and their character developments. Especially Zuko, so badass.
Yea, I definitely recommend this.
A perfect final season, all the characters got a moment to shine and the arc of each main character is amazing.
The third season was the best.

The perfect conclusion to the serie
I enjoy every single episode

It's just so good. The plot, the characters. Don't let the fact that it's officially a kids series get in the way of watching it. I don't even think it is a kids series. I loved it as a kid and I love it now, and my parents love it as well. Great show!!
Absolutely Phenomenal Series

The best TV show I ever watched. An amazing story, with morals, character development, real-world problems for every age. I will definitely rewatch it multiple times and get my best friend to watch it as well!
Perfect in every single way.
best show every. just so good

Book 3 is an insane, terrific, and intense ride to sit through. With much more moments to memorize and a series finale to put fans waiting for The Legend of Korra excitedly, Avatar: The Last Airbender ends with an amazing season.
This tv show had the best character development and amazing story line!!! they need to make more stories about the avatars and season 4 of Aang the avatar
Absolutely AMAZING series! Exciting storyline and great character development based on a beautiful culture. ❤️
One of the best shows ever made. The character development, animation, humor and action in this show is unmatched.

This show has always tackled heavy sociopolitical issues while maintaining a perfectly timed, charming humor and wonderful characters. The third season is no different. The animation is beautifully done, whether aesthetically, compositionally, or the choreography itself. I saw this series years ago and I still remember the music score. The episodes are engaging, but more importantly, thought-provoking--especially in how the themes from the first season are woven into Aang's fundamental character development as well as the external narrative. Every moment is filled with sincere emotion clearly imbued by the creators. Beautiful work.

My favorite show of all time.  2nd time watching it all the way through!  My kids love it.  

Growing up, it was easily dismissed at a glance by my parents as, "just a stupid kid show about a boy with an arrow on his head."  I finally got them to actually try it.  Now they are binge watching it for their "romantic dates,"  applying it to their own "religious metaphors", and loving every second of it.  It is by far one of the greatest series of all time.  I love Avatar the Last Airbender!

from the beginning i have praise this show from the first season to the second season and i am so happy and amazed how they can make this show from start to finished amazing one of my favorite endings of a show of all time

One of the best animated series I have ever seen. So much heart and good humour and very well written. Extremely likeable characters and overall story. Just re-watched it all on Netflix and it was a joyful experience. Recommended for kids and adults alike.
With more incredible animation, characters and humour, this season is a satisfying conclusion to one of the greatest animated shows in history.
zula iro zuko the fire nation the transformation of people and places loved this show

This is one of the best kids genre TV shows ever done. The show appeals to both kids and adults alike, because of how well the story was written. Sure it has some goofy moments in it, but that is OK, because it did not break the continuity of the story. The second thing is how great the story arch and character development were done. The story draws you into caring about the characters which always makes a good story!  I plan on watching this again and again!

I will watch this series many times. I apologize to all the people around me that have to listen to me go on about it. Everything shines, but the thing I appreciate most is how the magic--how the lore--all serves the characters. A series about people controlling the elements that shows how the elements control those people. A series about people with unlimited power undone by the most subtle and human things. A series worth watching at any age with anyone. Absolutely beautiful.
This show is amazing. From story, characters, voice acting (Fire lord Ozai's voice sound familiar 😉) and direction all great. Music makes it even better.

Honestly one of, if not the greatest television show to ever be produced. Incredibly, thematically rich. Well developed multi layered characters. A gorgeos plot accompanied with an equally beautiful art style. Just overall a masterpiece that has and will live the test of time.
This is the gratest animated series ever created
Brilliant show. Transcends generations.

The best season so far. We see and understand the redemption of Zuko. Aang is funnier than ever and the show has never been so entertaining. The final was so wonderfully written, that i can't do it any justice with normal words.
You already KNOW why this is 5/5 stars. Romance? Action? Comedy? Powers? Culture? This show has it all.

Such a good show. Fun, addicting, emotional and powerful in all kind of ways. The third and final chapter proves to be better than the previous seasons as we see huge character development of Aang, Katara and Toph. But most importantly, Zuko's story arc developed incredible as he decides to switch sides in a crucial moment in the show. The last two episodes are intense and I wished that Aang's duel with Ozai would've lasted longer, but I'm happy the way the creators decided to end this astonishing piece of television.
This season was much better than the first two seasons. Zuko actually had a better story arc than the movie version. Must see season.
Good. But not as good as Space Force....
Greatest TV show I have watched.
Maybe the best TV show of all time. Perfection
Best and more profound show ever! and not just for children
Never loved a show like I love this show.

I rewatched this show that I remembered and loved from my childhood and found myself to be surprised by the amount of perfection this show has. Avatar: The Last Airbender has an incredible plot within all three of its seasons, beautifully played recursive themes, and perhaps the most perfectly executed examples of character development, especially through Zuko. Avatar is a series meant for all audiences.

Season three is absolute perfection. The episodes with a story are thrilling and unpredictable, and when they end in defeat you can really feel the frustration of the characters. Each filler episode is its own little gem, telling intricate stories that effortlessly bounce between tones -- comedic, heartwarming, moving. They add depth to every character and beautifully handle their struggles. The finale was perfect, portraying the evolution of the characters and tying up all loose ends.
The best Gateway Anime out there.  Lots of fun for the whole family!
Best series finale anyone can ask for. Every character finds closure, villains are dealt with very respectfully.

one of the greatest shows of all time. loved it as a child but truly appreciate it as a grown man. one of the most well written shows with the best character development you are likely to find anywhere. give it a watch

This season brings the story arcs of the first two seasons to an incredible and satisfying end. For a kids show, it's remarkably nuanced. No main characters are one-sided, each is incredibly deep. The story is compelling. If you were thinking about watching the series and wanted to look at season 3 reviews- then my advice is to watch each season, You will be pleased

The greatest tv show of all time. Other than the episode the great divide, every episode was enlightening, emotional, and entertaining. Had some of the best villains and charachter arcs in cinematic history. The music is one of the best parts that are overshadowed. This is not a kids show. This is a show that anyone could watch and find the beauty in. It is by far the best television show I have ever watched. It surpassed any movie I have ever watched either. Watching as an adult versus as a kid,  I realized how incredibly diverse it was in real life issues, historic lessons and culture. 100 stars if I could give it stll wouldnt be enough. I can't wait for the live action version.
The hype is completely true, great show for all ages.
With Stunning Bisuals, Spectacular Character Development, Top-Notch Humor, and Love, Avatar: The Last Airbender is one of the Greatest Stories Ever Told.

Avatar Series is most likely the best creative production I've ever watched. The characters and their beliefs make them unique and lovable to the audience. I have watched this series at least 4 times and I do not get tired of being part of their amazing journey. It  makes me so mad that the live-action was a disgusting disaster but maybe because the bar is up so high...

This may be the best thing to ever come from Nickelodeon. The character development in this show is unreal, and this final season wraps it up perfectly. Zuko just might be one of the best characters ever, in any TV show or movie. He is the key to making the show a masterpiece.
With wonderful voice acting and a story that thinks deeper than even the most demanding audience could want, Avatar wraps up its plot in most satisfying fashion.
The last season of TLA is incredible. They have such dynamic characters, compelling villains, life lessons, incredible action, and more all packed in one place.
Super good bake. Checked all the boxes.
This show has my favorite conclusion in literally any fantasy story ever. The characters, worlds, bending/action, culture, beauty, and everything in between, is genuinely and absolutely perfect

No words to describe how good this show is. This season puts so much in perspective, while also offering amazing anamations and one of the best fight scenes I've ever seen. They have spared no efforts in making this a beautiful artwork
One of the best things I've ever seen. Deep characters, deep themes, great writing, great storytelling. Everything is just so close to perfection.

if you haven't seen this watch in now!!!
Seriously, if you reading this and haven't yet seen the show, stop what your doing and go frikkin watch it! :)
The finale was breathtaking. It brought everything together. Seeing the resolution of many of the plot points, and the relationship of the gang, was all really satisfying.
A "heroes journey" wrapped in a  "good versus evil" told as a "coming of age" tale. An incredible story for a children's show. The directing, humor, themes, characters, music, culture, all of it.

Avatar the last airbender season 3 is probably one of the greatest endings in a tv show, the season 3, have some amazing episodes like the day of the black sun part 1 and 2, the Sozin's comet part 1, 2, 3 and 4, I prefer the second season for how few bad episodes it has, this one have some bad ones (there are no bad Avatar episodes there are just some of them that aren't as good as others) but they are still pretty enjoyable, and I will say that this season have one of the best scenes (if it is not the best scene) in the whole series; the Agni kai between Zuko and Azula that scene is just fenomenal in every possible way, the music takes the scene the animation starts to become even more impressive, it is just great, one thing I really like is Aang in this season, I like how he feels guilty about have lost Ba Sing Se and I also really like that the first time they try to defeat the firelord they failed, they really failed, I think this season have the best Aang writing. It is an amazing and epic end for a one of the bests tv shows ever that is why I will give Avatar the last airbender season 3 a 10 out of 10

The 3rd season of Avatar is my least favorite.  It still had great characters and stuff but after the defeat of the heroes in the last season almost every character is different except for Toph.  The season opened strong but then led into the worst episodes of the series (except for the great divide.).  There was this lame assassin that was hired to kill the avatar and he was just merely an obstacle with no character at all.  Once they invaded the Fire Nation in The day of Black sun the show got great again and the characters seemed more similar to their appearances in the first two seasons (Except for Zuko).  The ending was a 4 part epic with great animation and fight scenes.  This was such a great show
This show is something that everyone needs to see. Im not a critic, this is my opinion and i truly believe that this is a MUST WATCH for anyone of any age.
Here we have the perfect wrap up of philosophy, morality, war, and love from this beloved series that will carry on for generations and into the next series.
The perfect story telling, there will never be anything this good again
Easily the best animated show ever created, arguably the best t.v. series period. If you have not seen this, regardless of your age, you're missing out.
What a great ending! Masterfully done! This show is just a masterpiece at storytelling and emotions! The action scenes are amazing and just........WOW......GO WATCH THIS SHOW!!!!
Wholly satisfying conclusion to the show. Character arcs are wonderfully completed, and the show remains thrilling right to the end, including an extremely memorable final fight.
Amazing just amazing

Absolutely Masterpiece. 
I was really afraid of the final; however, they completed this splendid series with great decision.
Avatar: The Last Airbender is a TV series that I loved as a kid and continue to love as an adult. For me, that is a test that no other animated series has passed.
The best written animated series ever produced. I'm blessed to have grown up with this show. Truly a work of art.
This is the best animation ever made, I don't know how they came up with all this but it's really original and mind blowing. THANK YOUUUUUUU!!!!!!!
The idea is of the show about bringing balance in the world and the comedy, effects which entertains viewers are the key to total perfection of this show.

Just finished watching it for the fourth time and I'm still as in love as the first time. My favorite show of all time. Period. Full stop. Simply amazing. The concept, world building, the writing, the characters, the arcs and development of the story. Everything was made with such care and thought that it shows in every second of the 61 episodes. It teaches you meaningful lessons while still being funny and entertaining. I wish I could watch it again for the first time. But then again, maybe it wouldn't evoke the happy childhood memories it does. Everyone should watch this show, no matter what age or who they are.
The third season is amazing along with the whole series and finishes up the story with an incredibly satisfying ending.
La mejor serie de todos los tiempos.

Anyone who knows the behind-the-scenes of this show should be completely amazed, as I am, that they were able to pull off the completely perfect ending that is season 3.  Initially, this was supposed to be two seasons, but the creators had to pack it all into 21 episodes.  
The last 4 episodes make a pretty solid mini-movie.  A wonderful end to an amazing story arc!
I loved it so much I bought the show on DVD. Worth every penny.

On the heels of two exemplary seasons, season 3 somehow tops them both, ending with a worthy conclusion to a truly legendary series.  I've never watched a series more than once -  I'm on my fourth Avatar watch-through.

This is absolutley one of the best shows I have ever seen and hits all the tragic notes at an even pace with its comedy. Although the first few episode are a little rough its almost impossible to notice as you are too busy laughing and crying along with the characters. Truly a masterpiece.
A good show must have an outstanding ending to be great. Avatar: The Last Airbender is just that. Words don't do it justice.
I love the story line, animation, and how the characters change over time

The strongest season yet!
The first half focuses on regrouping and gaining more insight into the daily life of the Fire Nation for Team Avatar, while Zuko learns that finally getting what he's wanted for so long isn't what he'd expected it to be.
In the second half of the season everybody gets quite a meaningful episode (or two) where the characters story arc 'matures", all culminating in the brilliant 4-part season finale!
Probably the best season, much like the other seasons only that team avatar is more complete with even Zuko ending up joining.
The third and last season begins surprisingly lame, but gets better from there, culminating in a four-part finale that screams the word "epic" with its every frame

When I was in middle school, Nickelodeon used to play reruns of Avatar: The Last Airbender all the time. Back then it was still a relatively new show, but I never remembered it airing or ending. However, it was one of the only shows that my sister and I could agree on watching, so I remember the reruns well. I never watched the full show in order. I never saw all the episodes. Only bits and pieces of different episodes stuck with me over time. I always thought it was a good show, but it was never anything more than that. Just some good entertainment. As Ive grown up (some would say I havent), Ive gotten into conversations about it here and there. Either people remember it like I do, as a pretty good, fun show, or they love it to death, acting like its the greatest television show to ever stream across the planet. Hearing peoples adoration for Avatar over the years, Ive gotten curious. Had I missed something? Was it better than I remembered? So I decided to re-watch it these past couple months. Long story short: Avatar: The Last Airbender IS the greatest television show of all time. 

As I made my way through The Last Airbender, I was continually shocked by how good the show was. Every few episodes or so I was blown away that a cartoon could be so good. I now realize the fault in my thinking. I underestimated the show because its a cartoon. I guess it worked in the shows favor, because I ended up appreciating it even more, but its unfair towards the creators. People tend to think that cartoons are just for kids, simply because theyre animated. Recently, with the success of shows like Bojack Horsemen and Rick and Morty, people have understood that cartoons can be incredibly, sometimes shockingly, deep and adult. But because Avatar is a Nickelodeon cartoon, people still characterize it as a kids show. The truth is that Avatar is technically a kids show, but more so than any other kids show ever, it can be enjoyed by anyone. An eight year-old and a 98 year-old can sit down together and receive the same level of enjoyment from it. Because of this, I would call Avatar family-friendly. Its not a kids show. Its an everyone show, and that might be one of its greatest strengths. Because of Avatars incredibly wide audience, it can touch on serious, profound, and emotional issues without being too heavy-handed or serious. So its serious without being serious, if that makes any sense. Regardless of everything I just said, I was still a bit embarrassed when I first started watching. During an early episode, before I realized how amazing the show actually is, my roommate and his girlfriend walked into our apartment. I immediately smiled and said, I know. Im watching a kids show on a Friday night. Dont judge me. Later my roommate told me that his girlfriend had said, I dont know why he apologized. That show is fantastic. Turns out I wasnt being lame for watching Avatar; I was being lame for watching Avatar on a Friday night.  

Now its time for me to explain why I think Avatar is so good. To be honest, the answer is everything, but Ill try and be a bit more specific. First of all, the characters are fantastic. Theyre richly drawn, and they feel like real people in a real universe. The show starts off slowly with small, serialized adventures. The story becomes more defined eventually, and thankfully a lot of what gets introduced early on is brought back in satisfying ways. The best part about the early episodes is that they slowly and slyly add mounds of characterization to each character, gradually building your affection for them overtime. By the end of the first season, youve been introduced to an incredible world, and youve fallen in love with the characters that inhabit it. The second season introduces new characters, and the third brings them together for an amazing finale. The way the show adds texture to its main and secondary characters is genuinely something to be admired. Nobody is one-note. Nobody is simple. They really do feel real. 

From a story standpoint, Avatar is also fantastic. The show runs 61 episodes overall, and I would say all except maybe ten work towards the larger narrative. These ten or so episodes are the most episodic of the bunch, but even at their worst, they still manage to add characterization and simple fun to the series. (One of) The thing(s) that makes Avatar so special is how its never black and white. There is good and evil everywhere, in the heroes and the villains. This only adds to the universe as a whole, making it feel lived-in and believable. From an action standpoint, the show is simply stunning. The action scenes are based on real-life martial arts, and the animation brings them to life fully and awesomely. The animation itself is beautiful, and it only gets better as the series goes on. The cinematography is fantastic; the way scenes are framed adds depth to them that would be lost in a lessor effort. The music is amazing. The humor is on point. The emotion is real. The themes are deep. It does not get better than this. 

The Last Airbender ends in a four-part finale thats essentially a 90 minute movie. Like Avengers: Infinity War, it only works with the foundation that comes before it. But with that foundation, Avatars finale proves itself to be one of the greatest conclusions to anything ever. After watching the entire show, it will make you cheer and laugh and cry. Im not the kind of person who yells things out while watching a movie. The only time I ever remember doing this was during the end of Infinity War for that matter, and I think that was completely called for. But multiple times during Avatars finale, I howled at the screen; it was that good. Part of the reason the finale is so satisfying is because the show isnt dragged out forever. Most TV shows are aired until theyre no longer popular, which leaves them with lackluster and narratively dry endings. Think of The Office for example. Avatar has three planned-out seasons. It wasnt cancelled; it was designed to be three seasons long. Because of this planning, every character is given exactly the amount of time they need to develop, and everything comes together perfectly in the end. 

Trust me, Im not crazy. If you dont believe me, google Avatar right now. Youll see that I am far from the only one who thinks this way. Years of bad publicity from Nickelodeon, a terrible movie adaptation, and a James Cameron movie of the same name have taken the spotlight away from Avatar. But nothing deserves it more than this show. I highly recommend it. Please, if youve managed to get to the end of this review, give Avatar a chance. You wont realize how amazing it is until its over, but by then youll want to watch it again anyways. Thats because Avatar: The Last Airbender is a modern masterpiece.

The greatest animated series of all time and undoubtedly one of the best shows ever aired in general. Somehow it manages to weave quirky humor, a captivating plot, and incredibly touching character arcs into one amazing show. I doubt there will be a 'children's' show that can even begin to compare with this masterpiece for a very long time.

90% for this one, it kinda took a different approach in telling the story. Although there is alot of perfect moments between Aang Katara Sokka Toph and Zuko, this season is more of a 1 storyline kind of thing. Although this season provides us with the best best best season finale fight ever made. Zuko vs Azula, and Aang vs Ozai is both litttttt.
You couldn't have asked for a better conclusion to a TV series than what we got.
One of the most heartwarming and epic Seasons of any show ever. Hard to think of something I didn't like.

Avatar takes you to a fabulous journey of self spiritual discovery, with a mix of adventure, witty comedy, extraordinary martial arts action and complex character developments. The series succeeds in getting you fully entangled in its drama, presenting you with an amazingly captivating plot.
You become an instant fan once you finish watching it!
the greates show in the world
Dragon ball level action with the heart of naruto=Avatar's finale

Greatest SHOW OF ALL TIME. HAS A PERFECT MIX OF ALL GENRES WITH A WONDERFUL OVER ARCHING PLOT AND DEEP DEEP CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT WITHIN THREE SHORT SEASONS. NO OTHER SHOWS HAS BROUGHT SO MUCH JOY AND HEARTBREAK, ALONG WITH LAUGHS AND PHILOSOPHICAL IDEOLOGY. TO SUM IN ONE WORD, BRILLIANT. 
--NR
tHe very last episode was underwhelming, average and predictable. It left me disappointed and with a hollow feeling, but apart from that the series was great, innovative and creative

As if the show couldn't improve from Book 2: Water, the third installment of Avatar; The Last Airbender is nothing short of perfection. Book 3: Fire manages to further develop already completely fleshed out characters; leading them to be more realistic and emotionally complex than ever. Each character has a meaningful role in the series, and no component goes unused. Each moment is perfectly laid out, and each episode makes you want to watch the next. Book 3 will bring you a wide range of emotions; from joy to anger to sadness to relief. I am utterly in awe of how incredible this show is, and I truthfully believe it is on par with some of the best television ever made.

This season is absolutely perfect. The way they fleshed out and developed every character in this season was masterfully done, and the story became so epic. The ending was great, the characters are fantastic, the pacing is perfect, everything is perfect.

The big one, the season in which all of our characters have become truly matured and now have to confront not just physical enemies but their own mindsets and convictions as well. This season asks us what it means to forgive, it asks us what it means to atone... it asks us what it means to have to kill. And it culminates in a perfectly arranged 4 part finale that really compares more to a feature film than a television series.

And then the whole thing wraps up beautifully. Truly a show that few can rival.

One of the best cartoon shows I've seen. Definitely worth watching every season. Every episode has its own story so it keeps things interesting. Its entertaining, funny and not only for kids, but for all ages.

This is the king of all animated television. Its so focused on the story and thats why theres no shame in loving it as an adult. Every episode is entertaining, every character has layers, and its truly a masterful piece of work. The best show to ever be on Nickelodeon. Its a creative and enjoyable show that while not very long, is mesmerizing the whole way through. Dont knock this one off as just another kids show. Itll blow you away.
One of the best conclusions that I have seen in a show, this show should be held as one of the best in history
